Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Mark Warner told PolitiFact National's "Lie of the Year" in 2013, when in fact it was President Barack Obama who received that distinction.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that it was President Obama, not Mark Warner, who received the "Lie of the Year" title in 2013.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or specific details to back up the assertion that Mark Warner told a lie that was deemed the "Lie of the Year" by PolitiFact National.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Mark Warner's statement about not supporting a health care reform plan that would take away current healthcare plans is a lie, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists, which is that the claim is a misinterpretation or misrepresentation of the facts, as it confuses Mark Warner with President Obama in regards to the "Lie of the Year" title.
